If you're looking for a historical story with a complex and thought-provoking plot, I recommend "JFK". This 1991 film features a star-studded cast including Robert De Niro and Kevin Costner and delves into the assassination of President John F. Kennedy.

If you're interested in a more lighthearted historical movie with a beautiful backdrop, I recommend "The White Countess". This 2005 film features Lynn Redgrave and portrays a complex and intriguing relationship between a blind American diplomat and a young Russian refugee.

If you're looking for something more suspenseful and with a more psychological tone, I recommend "Zero Effect". This 1998 film stars Angela Featherstone and Jake Kasdan and features an intriguing plot about blackmail and missing keys.
